Cairo.description: Cairo, the 'City of a Thousand Minarets,' is a vibrant metropolis where ancient history and modern life collide. As the largest city in the Arab world, it buzzes with energy amidst Pharaonic, Coptic, and Islamic landmarks.

places.name: Khan el-Khalili
places.description: A bustling medieval bazaar dating back to 1382, where narrow alleyways overflow with spices, lanterns, jewelry, and traditional crafts. The air fills with scents of perfumes and the sounds of merchants bargaining.

places.name: Cairo Tower
places.description: Standing 187 meters tall, this iconic lotus-shaped tower offers panoramic 360-degree views of greater Cairo. A modernist landmark providing the best vantage point to appreciate the city's vast expanse.

places.name: Citadel of Saladin
places.description: A magnificent Islamic fortification overlooking Cairo from the Mokattam Hills. This medieval fortress served as Egypt's seat of government for nearly 700 years and houses stunning mosques and museums.

places.name: Al-Azhar Mosque
places.description: One of the oldest universities in the world, founded in 970 AD. This architectural masterpiece represents the epicenter of Islamic learning and features beautiful courtyards and prayer halls.

places.name: Mosque of Muhammad Ali
places.description: Known as the Alabaster Mosque, this Ottoman-era masterpiece dominates the Cairo skyline. Its twin minarets and massive dome create one of the most recognizable silhouettes in the city.

Giza.description: The gateway to ancient Egypt's most iconic monuments, where the desert plateau hosts the legendary Pyramids and Sphinx that have captivated travelers for millennia.

places.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
places.description: The sole surviving wonder of the ancient world, built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu around 2560 BC. This engineering marvel stood as the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.

places.name: Grand Egyptian Museum
places.description: The world's largest archaeological museum, housing over 100,000 artifacts including the complete Tutankhamun collection. A state-of-the-art facility showcasing Egypt's priceless heritage.

places.name: Great Sphinx
places.description: The mythical creature with a lion's body and human head, carved from a single limestone outcrop. This enigmatic guardian of the Giza Plateau has watched over the pyramids for 4,500 years.

places.name: Solar Boat Museum
places.description: Home to a perfectly reconstructed cedarwood boat buried near the Great Pyramid for Pharaoh Khufu's journey to the afterlife. An incredible preservation of ancient Egyptian maritime technology.

Luxor.description: Often called the world's greatest open-air museum, this city stands on the site of ancient Thebes, featuring the most spectacular concentration of Pharaonic monuments in Egypt.

places.name: Karnak Temple
places.description: A vast temple complex that took over 2,000 years to build, featuring the magnificent Great Hypostyle Hall with 134 massive columns. The largest religious building ever constructed.

places.name: Valley of the Kings
places.description: The burial ground of pharaohs and powerful nobles for nearly 500 years, containing 63 magnificent tombs including Tutankhamun's famous discovery in 1922.

places.name: Luxor Temple
places.description: A majestic temple complex on the east bank of the Nile, famously connected to Karnak by the Avenue of Sphinxes. Particularly stunning when illuminated at night.

places.name: Hatshepsut Temple
places.description: A stunning terraced mortuary temple built into limestone cliffs, dedicated to Queen Hatshepsut - one of Egypt's most successful female pharaohs.

Aswan.description: A tranquil Nile-side city known for its beautiful islands, Nubian culture, and spectacular sunsets. The gateway to monumental temples and the engineering marvel of the High Dam.

places.name: Abu Simbel
places.description: The magnificent rock-cut temples of Ramses II, relocated to save them from Lake Nasser's rising waters. Famous for the sun illuminating the inner sanctuary twice yearly.

places.name: Philae Temple
places.description: The beautiful island temple dedicated to goddess Isis, featuring exquisite Ptolemaic architecture. Rescued and relocated after the Aswan Dam's construction.

places.name: Aswan High Dam
places.description: An engineering masterpiece that created Lake Nasser and transformed Egypt's agriculture. One of the largest embankment dams in the world.

places.name: Nubian Village
places.description: Vibrant communities along the Nile banks known for colorful houses, rich traditions, and warm hospitality. A living testament to Nubian culture and heritage.

Alexandria.description: The Mediterranean jewel founded by Alexander the Great, once home to the legendary Library and Lighthouse. A city where Greco-Roman history meets coastal charm.

places.name: Bibliotheca Alexandrina
places.description: A stunning modern revival of the ancient Library of Alexandria, featuring innovative architecture and housing millions of books in a magnificent cultural center.

places.name: Qaitbay Citadel
places.description: A 15th-century defensive fortress built on the exact site of the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria, offering panoramic Mediterranean views from its ramparts.

places.name: Montaza Palace
places.description: A beautiful royal palace complex with lush gardens stretching along the Mediterranean coast. The perfect blend of Ottoman and Florentine architectural styles.

places.name: Pompey's Pillar
places.description: A massive 25-meter red granite column rising from ancient ruins, representing one of the largest monolithic columns ever erected in the ancient world.

Sharm El Sheikh.description: Egypt's premier Red Sea resort, famous for crystal-clear waters, vibrant coral reefs, and year-round sunshine. A paradise for divers and beach lovers alike.

places.name: Ras Mohammed National Park
places.description: World-renowned marine protected area at the southern tip of Sinai, offering some of the planet's most spectacular coral reefs and diverse marine life.

places.name: Naama Bay
places.description: The heart of Sharm's tourism, featuring a beautiful sandy beach, luxury resorts, and vibrant nightlife. The perfect base for Red Sea adventures.

Hurghada.description: A bustling Red Sea resort town transformed from fishing village to diving mecca, offering endless beaches, water sports, and access to pristine marine ecosystems.

places.name: Giftun Island
places.description: A protected natural paradise offering white sand beaches and exceptional snorkeling opportunities in the clear Red Sea waters just offshore from Hurghada.

places.name: Hurghada Marina
places.description: A modern waterfront development with luxury yachts, restaurants, and shops. The perfect place for evening strolls and watching spectacular sunsets.

places.name: El Gouna
places.description: An upscale resort town known as the 'Venice of the Red Sea' for its beautiful lagoons, upscale hotels, and sophisticated architecture amid desert landscapes.

Dubai.description: A city of superlatives where traditional souks stand in the shadow of record-breaking skyscrapers. A global hub known for luxury shopping, innovative architecture, and ambitious projects.

places.name: Burj Khalifa
places.description: The world's tallest building at 828 meters, featuring an observation deck on the 148th floor with breathtaking views of Dubai's dramatic skyline and desert beyond.

places.name: The Dubai Mall
places.description: One of the world's largest shopping destinations with over 1,200 stores, an aquarium, ice rink, and direct access to the Burj Khalifa and Dubai Fountain.

Abu Dhabi.description: The sophisticated capital of the UAE, blending modern architecture with cultural institutions on a network of natural islands in the Arabian Gulf.

places.name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
places.description: A breathtaking architectural masterpiece capable of holding 40,000 worshippers, featuring 82 domes, 1,000 columns, and the world's largest hand-knotted carpet.

places.name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
places.description: An architectural marvel housing art and artifacts from around the world under a stunning perforated dome that creates a 'rain of light' effect.

Riyadh.description: The modern capital rising dramatically from the desert, where gleaming skyscrapers stand alongside historic mud-brick palaces in the heart of the Arabian Peninsula.

places.name: Kingdom Centre
places.description: An iconic 99-story skyscraper with a unique sky bridge offering panoramic city views, symbolizing Riyadh's transformation into a modern metropolis.

places.name: Al-Masmak Fortress
places.description: A clay and mud-brick fort celebrating the birthplace of modern Saudi Arabia, where the recapture of Riyadh in 1902 marked the beginning of unification.

Jeddah.description: The gateway to Mecca and a historic port city on the Red Sea, known for its coral architecture, vibrant souks, and the world's tallest fountain.

places.name: King Fahd's Fountain
places.description: The world's tallest fountain, shooting seawater 312 meters into the air - visible throughout much of Jeddah and particularly spectacular when illuminated at night.

places.name: Al-Balad
places.description: The historic heart of Jeddah featuring coral houses with ornate wooden balconies, traditional souks, and narrow alleyways that whisper tales of ancient trade routes.

Petra.description: The legendary 'Rose-Red City' carved directly into vibrant sandstone cliffs, lost to the Western world for centuries and rediscovered as one of the New Seven Wonders.

places.name: Al-Khazneh (The Treasury)
places.description: Petra's most magnificent facade, intricately carved into pink sandstone and made famous by Indiana Jones. The stunning first glimpse for visitors entering through the Siq.

places.name: The Monastery (Ad-Deir)
places.description: An enormous rock-cut monument even larger than the Treasury, reached by climbing 800 steps and offering breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains.

Amman.description: Jordan's modern capital built on seven hills, where ancient Roman ruins blend seamlessly with bustling markets and contemporary art galleries in a city of contrasts.

places.name: Amman Citadel
places.description: A historical site overlooking downtown Amman, featuring Roman, Byzantine, and Umayyad ruins including the Temple of Hercules and offering panoramic city views.

places.name: Roman Theatre
places.description: A beautifully preserved 2nd-century Roman theatre carved into the hillside, capable of seating 6,000 spectators and still used for cultural performances today.

Paris.description: The 'City of Light' and global capital of art, fashion, and romance, where iconic landmarks, world-class museums, and charming cafes create an unforgettable urban experience.

places.name: Eiffel Tower
places.description: The iron lattice tower that has become the universal symbol of Paris, offering stunning city views from its platforms and sparkling with thousands of lights every evening.

places.name: Louvre Museum
places.description: The world's largest art museum housed in a former royal palace, home to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and thousands of other artistic treasures.

Marseille.description: France's oldest city and vibrant Mediterranean port, where diverse cultures mix amid historic neighborhoods, calanques, and the bustling Vieux-Port.

places.name: Basilique Notre-Dame de la Garde
places.description: Marseille's iconic basilica perched on the city's highest point, offering spectacular harbor views and recognized by its golden statue of the Virgin Mary.

places.name: Vieux-Port
places.description: The historic heart of Marseille for over 2,600 years, where fishing boats still dock daily and waterfront cafes buzz with activity amid the Mediterranean atmosphere.

Rome.description: The Eternal City where ancient history lives alongside modern life, with spectacular ruins, Baroque fountains, and vibrant piazzas around every corner.

places.name: Colosseum
places.description: The iconic Roman amphitheater that hosted gladiatorial contests and public spectacles, standing as a magnificent symbol of Imperial Rome's architectural prowess.

places.name: Trevi Fountain
places.description: The largest Baroque fountain in Rome, famous for its dramatic sculpture of Oceanus and the tradition of tossing coins over your shoulder to ensure a return to Rome.

Venice.description: The magical floating city built on 118 islands, where canals replace streets, gondolas glide by historic palaces, and romance fills the air in this unique UNESCO treasure.

places.name: St. Mark's Square
places.description: Venice's principal public square surrounded by iconic landmarks including St. Mark's Basilica and the Campanile, often called 'the drawing room of Europe.

places.name: Grand Canal
places.description: The main waterway winding through Venice in an S-shape, lined with magnificent palaces and churches that showcase the city's architectural evolution over centuries.

New York City.description: The city that never sleeps, a global hub of finance, culture, and innovation where iconic landmarks, world-class museums, and diverse neighborhoods create endless energy.

places.name: Statue of Liberty
places.description: The universal symbol of freedom and democracy, gifted by France in 1886, standing proudly in New York Harbor as a welcoming sight to millions of immigrants.

places.name: Central Park
places.description: An urban oasis in the heart of Manhattan featuring 843 acres of lawns, lakes, and woodlands. The most visited urban park in the United States.

Los Angeles.description: The entertainment capital of the world, where Hollywood glamour meets beach culture in a sprawling metropolis of creative energy and year-round sunshine.

places.name: Hollywood Sign
places.description: The iconic white letters perched on Mount Lee, representing the global entertainment industry and offering one of the most photographed views in Los Angeles.

places.name: Santa Monica Pier
places.description: A classic California beach pier featuring an amusement park, aquarium, and historic carousel. The perfect place to experience LA's famous beach culture.

London.description: A world capital blending ancient history with cutting-edge modernity, where royal palaces stand alongside innovative architecture in this vibrant, multicultural metropolis.

places.name: Big Ben
places.description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster, though commonly referring to the entire clock tower - an icon of British democracy.

places.name: Tower Bridge
places.description: The magnificent Victorian bascule and suspension bridge over the River Thames, often mistaken for London Bridge and featuring high-level walkways with panoramic views.

Edinburgh.description: Scotland's majestic capital built around an ancient volcanic rock, where medieval Old Town and Georgian New Town create one of Europe's most beautiful cityscapes.

places.name: Edinburgh Castle
places.description: An imposing fortress dominating the city skyline from Castle Rock, housing the Scottish Crown Jewels and providing breathtaking views of Edinburgh.

places.name: Royal Mile
places.description: The historic thoroughfare connecting Edinburgh Castle to Holyrood Palace, lined with medieval buildings, shops, pubs, and significant historical sites.

Tokyo.description: A dazzling metropolis where ultra-modern skyscrapers stand beside ancient temples in the world's most populous metropolitan area, offering endless discovery.

places.name: Shibuya Crossing
places.description: The world's busiest pedestrian crossing where thousands of people cross simultaneously from multiple directions, creating an organized chaos that symbolizes modern Tokyo.

places.name: Senso-ji Temple
places.description: Tokyo's oldest temple, dating back to 645 AD, featuring a magnificent five-story pagoda and the bustling Nakamise shopping street leading to the main hall.

Kyoto.description: Japan's cultural heart with over 2,000 temples and shrines, where geisha still walk historic streets and traditional arts flourish amid beautiful gardens and tea houses.

places.name: Fushimi Inari Shrine
places.description: Famous for its thousands of vibrant red torii gates forming paths up the sacred Mount Inari, dedicated to the Shinto god of rice and business.

places.name: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
places.description: A Zen temple completely covered in gold leaf, reflected perfectly in the mirror pond surrounding it - one of Japan's most photographed sights.

Barcelona.description: The cosmopolitan capital of Catalonia, famous for Gaudi's architectural masterpieces, vibrant street life, and beautiful Mediterranean beaches in a city of creative energy.

places.name: Sagrada Famlia
places.description: Antoni Gaudi's magnificent basilica, under construction since 1882 and featuring extraordinary organic architecture that blends Gothic and Art Nouveau forms.

places.name: Park Gell
places.description: A magical public park designed by Gaudi, featuring colorful mosaics, unusual structures, and panoramic views of Barcelona from its famous serpentine bench.

Madrid.description: Spain's vibrant capital in the heart of the country, known for elegant boulevards, world-class art museums, and lively plazas that buzz with energy day and night.

places.name: Prado Museum
places.description: One of the world's greatest art museums, housing masterpieces by Spanish masters including Velzquez, Goya, and El Greco in a magnificent neoclassical building.

places.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
places.description: The official residence of the Spanish royal family and the largest functioning royal palace in Europe, featuring opulent rooms and priceless art collections.

Berlin.name: Museum Island
Berlin.description: A magnificent complex of five internationally significant museums.

Munich.name: Marienplatz
Munich.description: A central square in the city centre of Munich.

Munich.name: BMW Museum
Munich.description: An automobile museum of BMW history.

Beijing.name: Great Wall of China
Beijing.description: A series of fortifications built across the historical northern borders.

Beijing.name: Summer Palace
Beijing.description: A vast ensemble of lakes, gardens and palaces.

Shanghai.name: The Bund
Shanghai.description: A waterfront area offering spectacular views of the Pudong skyline.

Shanghai.name: Yu Garden
Shanghai.description: An extensive Chinese garden located beside the City God Temple.

Sydney.name: Sydney Opera House
Sydney.description: A multi-venue performing arts centre famous for its shell-like design.

Sydney.name: Darling Harbour
Sydney.description: A harbour adjacent to the city centre of Sydney, known for recreation and dining.

Queensland.name: Great Barrier Reef
Queensland.description: The world's largest coral reef system.

Queensland.name: Daintree Rainforest
Queensland.description: A tropical rainforest on the north east coast of Queensland, the oldest in the world.

Rio de Janeiro.name: Christ the Redeemer
Rio de Janeiro.description: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ.

Rio de Janeiro.name: Selarn Steps
Rio de Janeiro.description: A set of world-famous steps covered in colorful tiles.

Foz do Iguacu.name: Iguazu Falls
Foz do Iguacu.description: The largest waterfall system in the world.

Foz do Iguacu.name: Bird Park
Foz do Iguacu.description: A privately owned zoological park, located near the Iguazu Falls.

Toronto.name: Distillery District
Toronto.description: A commercial and residential district containing numerous cafs, restaurants, and shops.

Banff.name: Lake Louise
Banff.description: A glacial lake within Banff National Park.

Banff.name: Banff Gondola
Banff.description: A cable car offering sweeping views of the six mountain ranges.

Istanbul.name: Hagia Sophia
Istanbul.description: A Late Antique place of worship in Istanbul.

Istanbul.name: Basilica Cistern
Istanbul.description: The largest of several hundred ancient cisterns that lie beneath the city of Istanbul.

Cappadocia.name: Fairy Chimneys
Cappadocia.description: Unique rock formations famous for hot air balloon rides.

Cappadocia.name: Uchisar Castle
Cappadocia.description: A rock-cut castle located at the highest point in Cappadocia.

Agra.name: Mehtab Bagh
Agra.description: A charbagh complex located north of the Taj Mahal complex.

Jaipur.name: Hawa Mahal
Jaipur.description: The 'Palace of Winds', known for its intricate pink sandstone lattice windows.

Jaipur.name: City Palace
Jaipur.description: A palace complex in Jaipur, which includes the Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal palaces.

Delhi.name: India Gate
Delhi.description: A war memorial located astride the Rajpath in New Delhi.

Delhi.name: Humayun's Tomb
Delhi.description: The tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India.

Bangkok.name: The Grand Palace
Bangkok.description: A complex of buildings that has been the official residence of the Kings of Siam.

Phuket.name: Patong Beach
Phuket.description: The main tourist resort on Phuket.

Phuket.name: Old Phuket Town
Phuket.description: A historic area with Sino-Portuguese architecture and colorful buildings.

Moscow.name: Red Square
Moscow.description: A city square in Moscow separating the Kremlin from the historic merchant quarter.

Moscow.name: St. Basil's Cathedral
Moscow.description: A church in Red Square known for its colorful onion domes.

Saint Petersburg.name: Hermitage Museum
Saint Petersburg.description: One of the largest and oldest museums in the world.

Saint Petersburg.name: Peterhof Palace
Saint Petersburg.description: A series of palaces and gardens, often referred to as the 'Russian Versailles'.

Cape Town.name: Table Mountain
Cape Town.description: A flat-topped mountain forming a prominent landmark.

Cape Town.name: Kirstenbosch Gardens
Cape Town.description: A famous botanical garden nestled at the eastern foot of Table Mountain.

Sibiu.name: ASTRA Museum
Sibiu.description: One of the largest open-air museums in Europe.

Bucharest.name: Palace of the Parliament
Bucharest.description: The heaviest building in the world.

Bucharest.name: Romanian Athenaeum
Bucharest.description: A concert hall in the center of Bucharest and a landmark of the city.

Athens.name: Acropolis of Athens
Athens.description: An ancient citadel on a rocky outcrop.

Athens.name: Syntagma Square
Athens.description: The central square of Athens, located in front of the Old Royal Palace.

Santorini.name: Oia
Santorini.description: A coastal town famous for its whitewashed houses.

Santorini.name: Fira
Santorini.description: The capital of Santorini, perched on the edge of the high caldera.

Buenos Aires.name: Recoleta Cemetery
Buenos Aires.description: A cemetery containing the graves of notable people, including Eva Pern.

Patagonia.name: Perito Moreno Glacier
Patagonia.description: A massive glacier in Los Glaciares National Park.

Patagonia.name: Mount Fitz Roy
Patagonia.description: A mountain located near El Chaltn, famous for hiking.

Zurich.name: Lake Zurich
Zurich.description: A lake offering swimming, boating and picnicking.

Zurich.name: Grossmnster
Zurich.description: A Romanesque-style Protestant church in Zurich.

Zermatt.name: Matterhorn
Zermatt.description: A mountain of the Alps, known for its distinct pyramid shape.

Zermatt.name: Gornergrat
Zermatt.description: A rocky ridge of the Pennine Alps, offering views of the Matterhorn.

Cusco.name: Machu Picchu
Cusco.description: A 15th-century Inca citadel set high in the Andes Mountains.

Cusco.name: Qorikancha
Cusco.description: The most important temple in the Inca Empire.

Lima.name: Miraflores
Lima.description: An upscale district known for its shopping and beaches.

Lima.name: Larco Museum
Lima.description: A privately owned museum of pre-Columbian art.

Marrakech.name: Jemaa el-Fnaa
Marrakech.description: A famous square and market place.

Chefchaouen.name: Medina
Chefchaouen.description: The old town famous for its blue-rinsed buildings.

Chefchaouen.name: Spanish Mosque
Chefchaouen.description: A mosque on a hill overlooking the blue city.

Lisbon.name: Praa do Comrcio
Lisbon.description: A large, harbour-facing plaza in Portugal's capital.

Sintra.name: Pena Palace
Sintra.description: A Romanticist castle that stands on the top of a hill.

Prague.name: Charles Bridge
Prague.description: A medieval stone arch bridge that crosses the Vltava river.

Prague.name: Old Town Hall (Prague)
Prague.imageSearch: Old Town Hall Prague Astronomical Clock
Prague.description: Famous for its medieval Astronomical Clock.

Budapest.name: Buda Castle
Budapest.description: The historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings.

Dubrovnik.name: City Walls
Dubrovnik.description: A series of defensive stone walls surrounding the city.

Dubrovnik.name: Lovrijenac
Dubrovnik.description: A fortress and theater outside the western wall of the city.

Split.name: Diocletian's Palace
Split.description: An ancient palace built for the Roman emperor Diocletian.

Split.name: Marjan Hill
Split.description: A hill on the peninsula of the city of Split, covered in a dense pine forest.

Amsterdam.name: Rijksmuseum
Amsterdam.description: A Dutch national museum dedicated to arts and history.

Amsterdam.name: Jordaan
Amsterdam.description: A district famous for its beautiful houses, nice restaurants and original shops.

Brussels.name: Royal Palace
Brussels.description: The official palace of the King and Queen of the Belgians.

Bruges.name: Belfry of Bruges
Bruges.description: A medieval bell tower in the center of Bruges.

Bruges.name: Lake of Love
Bruges.description: A romantic park with a lake and swans.

Taipei.name: Elephant Mountain
Taipei.description: A hiking trail offering the best views of Taipei 101.

Jiufen.name: Jiufen Old Street
Jiufen.description: A mountain area known for its maze of lanes and alleyways.

Jiufen.name: Golden Waterfall
Jiufen.description: A waterfall famous for its golden color due to heavy metal elements.

Ulaanbaatar.name: Sukhbaatar Square
Ulaanbaatar.description: The central square of Mongolia's capital.

Kathmandu.name: Boudhanath Stupa
Kathmandu.description: One of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal.

Kathmandu.name: Durbar Square
Kathmandu.description: The plaza in front of the old royal palace.

Islamabad.name: Pakistan Monument
Islamabad.description: A national monument and heritage museum.

Colombo.name: Gangaramaya Temple
Colombo.description: One of the most important Buddhist temples in Colombo.

Colombo.name: Lotus Tower
Colombo.description: A tower that is the tallest self-supported structure in South Asia.

Sigiriya.name: Pidurangala Rock
Sigiriya.description: A massive rock formation offering views of Sigiriya.

Nairobi.name: Nairobi National Park
Nairobi.description: A national park just 7km south of Nairobi.

Nairobi.name: Karen Blixen Museum
Nairobi.description: The former African home of the Danish author.

Masai Mara.name: Masai Mara Reserve
Masai Mara.description: A large game reserve in Narok.

Masai Mara.name: Mara River
Masai Mara.description: A river famous for the wildebeest migration crossing.

Zanzibar.name: Stone Town
Zanzibar.description: The old part of Zanzibar City.

Zanzibar.name: Prison Island
Zanzibar.description: An island famous for its giant tortoises.

Arusha.name: Arusha National Park
Arusha.description: A gem of varied ecosystems and spectacular views of Mt. Meru.

Kampala.name: Kasubi Tombs
Kampala.description: The site of the burial grounds for four kabakas.

Kampala.name: Uganda Museum
Kampala.description: A museum displaying Uganda's cultural heritage.

Kigali.name: Inema Art Center
Kigali.description: A collective of Rwandan creative artists.

Addis Ababa.name: Holy Trinity Cathedral
Addis Ababa.description: The highest ranking Orthodox cathedral in Addis Ababa.

Lalibela.name: Church of St. George
Lalibela.description: The most famous and best preserved of the rock-hewn churches.

Tunis.name: Bardo Museum
Tunis.description: One of the most important museums in the Mediterranean region.

Carthage.name: Carthage Ruins
Carthage.description: The archaeological site of the ancient city of Carthage.

Carthage.name: Byrsa Hill
Carthage.description: The walled citadel of ancient Carthage.

Algiers.name: Casbah of Algiers
Algiers.description: A unique medina type of city.

Algiers.name: Notre Dame d'Afrique
Algiers.description: A Roman Catholic basilica overlooking the Bay of Algiers.

Bali.name: Ubud Monkey Forest
Bali.description: A nature reserve and Hindu temple complex.

Bali.name: Tanah Lot
Bali.description: A rock formation home to the ancient Hindu pilgrimage temple.

Jakarta.name: National Monument
Jakarta.description: A tower in the center of Merdeka Square.

Jakarta.name: Istiqlal Mosque
Jakarta.description: The largest mosque in Southeast Asia.

Hanoi.name: Ha Long Bay
Hanoi.description: Known for its emerald waters and limestone islands.

Manila.name: Intramuros
Manila.description: The historic walled area within the city.

Manila.name: Rizal Park
Manila.description: A historic urban park in the Philippines.

Boracay.name: White Beach
Boracay.description: Famous for its powdery white sand.

Kuala Lumpur.name: Petronas Towers
Kuala Lumpur.description: Twin skyscrapers that dominate the skyline.

Kuala Lumpur.name: Batu Caves
Kuala Lumpur.description: A limestone hill that has a series of caves and cave temples.

Singapore.name: Marina Bay Sands
Singapore.description: An integrated resort fronting Marina Bay.

Singapore.name: Gardens by the Bay
Singapore.imageSearch: Supertree Grove Gardens by the Bay

Male.name: Grand Friday Mosque
Male.description: The biggest mosque in the Maldives.

Male.name: Male Fish Market
Male.description: The commercial heart of the island.

Santiago.name: Costanera Center
Santiago.description: Includes the tallest building in South America.

Santiago.name: San Cristobal Hill
Santiago.description: A hill in northern Santiago with beautiful views.

Atacama.name: Moon Valley
Atacama.description: Stone and sand formations which look similar to the moon.

Bogota.name: Monserrate
Bogota.description: A mountain that dominates the city center.

Bogota.name: Gold Museum
Bogota.description: Displays an extraordinary selection of pre-Hispanic gold work.

Cartagena.name: Walled City
Cartagena.description: A colonial walled city and fortress.

Auckland.name: Sky Tower
Auckland.description: The tallest freestanding structure in the Southern Hemisphere.

Queenstown.name: Milford Sound
Queenstown.description: A fiord known for towering Mitre Peak.

Oslo.name: Vigeland Park
Oslo.description: The world's largest sculpture park made by a single artist.

Oslo.name: Oslo Opera House
Oslo.description: Home of the Norwegian National Opera and Ballet.

Stockholm.name: Vasa Museum
Stockholm.description: Displays the only almost fully intact 17th-century ship.

Copenhagen.name: Tivoli Gardens
Copenhagen.description: A famous amusement park and pleasure garden.

Helsinki.name: Suomenlinna
Helsinki.description: An inhabited sea fortress built on six islands.

Galway.name: Cliffs of Moher
Galway.description: Sea cliffs located at the southwestern edge of the Burren region.

Vienna.name: Schnbrunn Palace
Vienna.description: The main summer residence of the Habsburg rulers.

Vienna.name: St. Stephen's Cathedral
Vienna.description: The mother church of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Vienna.

Hallstatt.name: Hallstatt Old Town
Hallstatt.description: A village known for its 16th-century Alpine houses.

Krakow.name: Main Market Square
Krakow.description: The main square of the Old Town of Krakw.
